bg.x2d.geo

Class GeoUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.geo.GeoUtils

  • public class GeoUtils
extends Object
    Contains static convenience method for Geometric operations. All angular operations take and return values in radians.
    Since:
    2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • lineIntersection

        public static PointUD lineIntersection(double x1,
                       double y1,
                       double x2,
                       double y2,
                       double x3,
                       double y3,
                       double x4,
                       double y4)
        Computes the intersection point between two lines, if one exists.
        Parameters:
        x1 - a first x point of the first line
        y1 - a first y point of the first line
        x2 - a second x point of the first line
        y2 - a second y point of the first line
        x3 - a first x point of the second line
        y3 - a first y point of the second line
        x4 - a second x point of the second line
        y4 - a second y point of the second line
        Returns:
        the intersection point, or null if one doesn't exist.

      • getMdpt

        public static PointUD getMdpt(PointUD p1,
              PointUD p2)
        Finds the midpoint of the line segment connecting the two given points.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the first point of the line segment
        p2 - the second point of the line segment
        Returns:
        the midpoint of the segment connecting p1 to p2

      • drawPolygon

        public static Polygon drawPolygon(Point2D[] points,
                  Graphics2D g2d,
                  Paint paint,
                  boolean fill)
        Draws a polygon on screen using the points provided as vertices.
        Parameters:
        points - vertices of the polygon
        g2d - graphics object to draw on
        paint - paint to be applied to the polygon
        fill - true if the polygon should be filled completely, false if only an outline should be drawn
        Returns:

      • rotatePoint

        public static Point2D.Double rotatePoint(Point2D point,
                         Point2D origin,
                         double angle)
        Algorithm that uses an algebraic rotation formula to transform a point from its current location x rads to a new position on the coordinate plane. This method is for convenience. It uses the given points to call the actual rotatePoint method, which takes double parameters.
        Parameters:
        p - point to be rotated
        origin - point to rotate around
        angle - angle measure to rotate, in radians.
        Returns:
        the rotated Point object.

      • rotatePoint

        public static PointUD rotatePoint(PointUD point,
                  PointUD origin,
                  double angle)

      • rotatePoint

        public static double[] rotatePoint(double x,
                   double y,
                   double x0,
                   double y0,
                   double angle)
        Algorithm that uses an algebraic rotation formula to transform a point from its current location x rads to a new position on the coordinate plane.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        x0 - x origin coordinate
        y0 - y origin coordinate
        angle - radians to rotate around the origin
        Returns:

      • terminal

        public static double terminal(double x,
              double y)
        Computes the terminal position of an angle using the given x, y coordinates drawn from the origin. The value returned from this method will be 0-2pi.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        y -
        Returns:

      • ref

        public static double ref(double x,
         double y)
        Computes the reference angle for the given x, y coordinates drawn from the origin. The value returned from this method will be between -pi/2 and pi/2.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:

      • quadrant

        public static int quadrant(double x,
           double y)
        Computes the quadrant the given point lies in based on the origin (0, 0).
        Parameters:
        x - x-coord of the point
        y - y-coord of the point
        Returns:
        int value 1, 2, 3 or 4 representing the point's quadrant based on the origin.
